info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 7:32AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Up to 12 inches over the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Coastal Range, Burney Basin and Shasta County Mountains above 3000 feet. Locally down to 1500 to 2000 feet this morning including portions of Interstate 5. * WHEN...Through 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels around 3000-6000 feet. Heaviest amounts expected above 3000 feet. Locally lower this morning down to around 1500 to 2000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
